answers.answer: Hello,I'm not familiar with anti-GAD and Stiff Person Syndrome (SPS).  But what I've come across regarding SPS notes an autoimmune process was originally postulated to underlie this syndrome since the disorder often occurred in conjunction with a variety of autoimmune diseases including thyroiditis, vitiligo, pernicious anemia, and (particularly) type 1 diabetes mellitus.  However gestational diabetes is associated with the development later in life of type II diabetes (not an auto-immune process, but the due to insulin resistance).  So I think these are two very distinct processes at work and it would be hard to predict how the two will interact with respect to your diabetes risk immediate postpartum or later in life.Best regards,Dr. Downing

question: Hello,I was tested for anti-GAD in neurology due to a muscle stiffness problem that I have been experiencing thoughout my pregnancy.  The test came back positive.  At about 24 weeks of pregnancy I was diagnosed with gestiational diabetes.  My question to this board is regarding the anti-GAD postive results and my gestatinal diabetes.  Since I tested postive for anti-GAD, does this mean i will have a higher chance of being diabetic after I give birth?  Thank you!
title: Anti-GAD and gestational diabetes
